subject: RE: [junit] JUnit 4 and public classes
msgSnippet: Elliotte, We don t plan to make that possible. I would like to know in what circumstances non-public test classes and methods would be valuable. Sincerely
messageBody:
Elliotte,

We don't plan to make that possible. I would like to know in what
circumstances non-public test classes and methods would be valuable.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Elliotte Harold
> Sent: Thursday, June 16, 2005 3:29 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] JUnit 4 and public classes
>
> Will JUnit 4 make it possible to have non-public test classes
> and test
> methods?
>
>
